H0.text: Horizontal layers are formed when sediments settle out of water.

H1.text: Separated layers are what sediments form when they settle out of water.

H2.text: Erosion is what sediments form when they settle out of water.

H3.text: Magnetic layers are formed when sediments settle out of water.

A4.text: Sedimentation is the deposition of sediments which results in the formation of sedimentary rock.

A5.text: Sedimentary rock are laid down in layers called beds or strata, each layer is horizontally laid down over the older ones.

A6.text: Erosion removes most deposited sediment shortly after deposition.
